detaileddescription.para: Bot id if any (e.g. role is a bot's role created when it was invited)

briefdescription.para: Role colour. A colour of 0 means no colour. If you want a black role, you must use the value 0x000001.

briefdescription.para: Role name Between 1 and 100 characters.

parameterdescription.para: thrown if role length is less than 1 character

briefdescription.para: Represents a role within a dpp::guild. Roles are combined via logical OR of the permission bitmasks, then channel-specific overrides can be applied on top, deny types apply a logic NOT to the bit mask, and allows apply a logical OR.

simplesect.para: Every guild has at least one role, called the 'everyone' role, which always has the same role ID as the guild's ID. This is the base permission set applied to all users where no other role or override applies, and is the starting value of the bit mask looped through to calculate channel permissions.
